title: Rodgers: Joining Tomlin, Steelers 'best for soul'
description: Aaron Rodgers called continuing his playing career with the Steelers a decision that was "best for my soul," and noted that coach Mike Tomlin was the biggest draw when it came to picking Pittsburgh.
author: Brooke Pryor

title: Judge crushes 469-foot HR, one of longest in K.C.
description: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge crushed a 469-foot home run that nearly left Kauffman Stadium in the first inning Tuesday night, continuing his season-long ravaging of pitchers across baseball.
author: Jeff Passan

title: Alcantara pitches 6 shutout innings as the Marlins edge the Pirates 3-2
description: Sandy Alcantara struck out six in six shutout innings, and the Miami Marlins edged the Pittsburgh Pirates 3-2 on Tuesday night. Alcantara (3-7) allowed three hits and walked one in his first win since April 12. The 2022 NL Cy Young Award winner went 0-7 with a 9.07 ERA in his previous nine starts.

title: Sean O'Malley reacts to UFC 316 loss, baffled by 'GOAT' Merab Dvalishvili
description: Sean O'Malley speaks in-depth for the first time since his UFC 316 in an honest and open discussion.

title: One year to World Cup, are Tuchel's England regressing after Southgate era?
description: No discernible plan. No identity. No improvement. With one year until the World Cup, how far off are Thomas Tuchel's England?

title: Record-breaking England cruise to win over Windies
description: England blast their way to a record score on home soil as they wrap up an emphatic series clean sweep with a 37-run win over West Indies in the third T20.

title: F1 2026 schedule revealed: Australian opener, Monaco moved, Madrid added
description: Formula 1 has confirmed a 24-race schedule for 2026 that will see Australia remain as the host of the opening round of the season.

title: Keane questions spirit of England group: 'Are they in it together?'
description: Roy Keane hit out at England after a miserable end to an underwhelming June international camp by saying "something is missing" from Thomas Tuchel's side.
